page.title: 13VIETNAMESE BOAT PEOPLE
page.content: In April 1980, ten Vietnamese families moved into accommodation on the Sutton Trust estate in Padgate.Each family was befriended by an English family who helped to prepare and furnish the house before the families moved from resettlement centres in the south of England.The children were taught English by a teacher specialising in English as a second language, and the adults were offered language tuition at night school by the same teacher,though few of the women attended these classes.In 1982 the first family moved to live with friends in Birmingham, closely followed by a second.In 1985, 3 more families moved to live with the Chinese communities in London.Of the 5 families left in Padgate, 4 of them are trying to exchange their houses for homes in London.
